text:
Average western food, had the half spring chicken with cream spaghetti.

Cream Spaghetti taste ok, portion quite acceptable good.

Fried spring chicken too small and dried until the little drumstick and wing also meatless. Maybe will try out others dishes next time.

Over heard my next table also complaining on their fish and chips.. flour too thick.. No comment on this..

Service still pretty good for the staff at the moment.. But food need to keep it up.. as their price also not cheap.. for $8.90 per set.. additional $3 for small bowl of salad, fries, and soup.

Sitting spacing as usual tight spacing, especially diners trying to squeeze their way through in-between the chairs and tables..

After the management does their arrangements replacing the table stand.. it's become very messy to dine in.. with the untidy arrangements of table and chairs around..
Average tasting Western food. What irks me is how they are so reluctant to give extra packets of Chilli sauce.  Only 2 packets per place. Max is 3 before they say no to u

The reason I rate 2 stars is not because of the food quality (food court standard), but because there was a tiny bit of bone in my beef steak, and it caused a big chip in my front teeth. It was an unfortunate event, but no diner would want to lose a bit of their teeth.

I got her name Siew Peng, it's caught my attention when I saw her walked to an elderly carefully and patiently to explain the variable foods options at the food manual board.(See photo)
Hence, I am here to write a complimentary of her positive attitude and hard working staffüëç
The Fries and Aglio Olio are my favorite. The price is reasonable. My kids love their western food
